intro: Michelia jianfenglingensis, commonly known as the Jianfengling Michelia, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Hainan Island, China. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows as a small evergreen tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and dark green, while its bark is smooth and grayish-brown. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species and is of significant interest in botanical research.
